The `tidymodels` package streamlines many aspects of statistical modeling and machine learning in R, using `tidyverse` principles.  This workshop will be a gentle introduction to the `tidymodels` package and how we can use it to set up simple models and select the best among competing models - a fundamental idea behind machine learning.

**Tuesday November 7, 11:30-1 PM**, DREAM Lab UCSB Library (RM 2322, Mountain side of the building on the second floor.)
Please RSVP [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxMZ7H-bH-fH8_jT9EXsHa3_Xu8rXqCAkCsRhHrRb7ujHx2A/viewform?usp=sf_link)

Pre-workshop prep: 

1. install the `tidymodels` package
2. fork and clone this repository: [2023-11-07-tidymodels_workshop](https://github.com/ecodatascience/2023-11-07-tidymodels_workshop)
